basics.name: Keyu He
basics.label: Student, Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Undergraduate double major in Computer Science and Applied & Computational Mathematics with a minor in Artificial Intelligence Applications. Passionate about explainable NLP systems, interpretable machine learning, and cross-disciplinary AI research.

education.area: Computer Science and Applied & Computational Mathematics
education.summary: Minor in Artificial Intelligence Applications. Dean’s List every semester and member of Phi Kappa Phi Honor Society.
courses: Language Models in Natural Language Processing (A)
Applied Machine Learning for Natural Language Processing (A)
Introduction to Algorithms and the Theory of Computing (A-)

publications.name: Assessing Language Models’ Capability to Explain to Different Audiences
publications.author: Brihi Joshi*, Keyu He* , Kaitlyn Zhou, Sadra Sabouri Halestani, Souti Chattopadhyay, Swabha Swayamdipta, Xiang Ren
publications.summary: Explores how GPT-generated explanations vary in text complexity and alignment with user roles in curiosity-driven scenarios.

publications.name: Beyond the Text: How Explanation Qualities Influence User Trust in Visual Language Models
publications.author: Keyu He, Brihi Joshi, Tejas Srinivasan, Swabha Swayamdipta
publications.summary: Identify limitations of current text-only metric and explore new vision-specific qualities to improve trust in explanations by VLMs.

publications.name: Attributing Culture-Conditioned Generations to Pretraining Corpora
publications.author: Huihan Li*, Arnav Goel*, Keyu He, Xiang Ren
publications.summary: This paper introduces MEMOed, a framework to analyze whether AI generations are driven by memorization or generalization, with a focus on cultural symbols.

publications.name: Enhancing Debugging Skills of LLMs with Prompt Engineering
publications.author: Keyu He*, Max Li*, and Joseph Liu*

projects.name: LLM Prompt Recovery
projects.summary: Developed a system to recover user prompts using fine-tuned Mixtral models, achieving top 3.4% in a Kaggle competition.
highlights: Achieved a score of 0.65 using sentence-T5-base and sharpened cosine similarity.
Ranked 75/2175 globally in the Kaggle competition.
Published fine-tuned model on Kaggle for broader access.

projects.name: AI-Based Career Advisor
projects.summary: Built an AI tool to assist users in planning career paths based on skills and interests.
highlights: Developed a Streamlit-based interactive UI integrating GPT-4o for job suggestions.
Implemented cosine similarity search for skill-job matching.
Integrated Bing AI for real-time job application link retrieval.

projects.name: Enhancing Debugging Skills of LLMs with Prompt Engineering
projects.summary: Improved LLM debugging capabilities through advanced prompt engineering techniques.
highlights: Experimented with various prompting strategies to enhance debugging efficiency.
Achieved significant improvements in LLM performance on debugging tasks.

projects.name: Automated Hate Speech Detection in Social Media
projects.summary: Developed an advanced ML model for detecting hate speech, achieving 94% accuracy.
highlights: Enhanced online safety and inclusivity through robust model optimization.

awards.title: Silver Medal, Kaggle Competition
awards.summary: Ranked 75/2175 (Top 3.4%) on the global leaderboard, LLM Prompt Recovery Project.

awards.title: USC Academic Achievement Award
awards.summary: Awarded in Fall 2022, Spring 2023, Spring 2024, and Fall 2024. Covered 11 units of tuition costs in total, amounting to approximately $24,000.

awards.title: 4th Place, USC Integral Bee Competition
awards.summary: Ranked 4th in the USC Integral Bee Competition.

awards.title: 1st Prize, International Linguistics Olympiad
awards.summary: Senior Level, Individual Open Round, China.

awards.title: 1st Prize, International Linguistics Olympiad
awards.summary: Senior Level, Team Open Round, China.
